name: Hotel Inglaterra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Inglaterra for one night, before moving over to the Parque Central (as the PC was full).
reviews.title: There's Better

likes.disliked: — Terrible breakfast, generally very average and not good value.

reviews.text: I was fairly happy at this hotel. Friendly staff, very good breakfast, good location, clean. My three traveling companions all had rooms on the first or the third floor and had no complaints. I was given Nr. 14 which means that you have to go down with the lift. It was very damp and the smell in the bathroom was terrible. It took ages to get a bit of hot water and when it did come, it was brown. There are no Kleenex either.
reviews.title: Do not accept a room on lower ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One morning, I was awoken by a loud noise outside my room and realized that it came from the gym where people were running on the treadmill and the TV was on. Conclusion: Overall, the hotel is ok but insist on a room on one of the upper floors!
reviews.title: Fairly Good

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in May based on a last-minute offer of €85 per room including breakfast. On checking in asked for room with view and were told there were none left. The hotel did not seem very full so presumably we were given smallish room at back because of the rate. Too bad because we if had had a nice room we would have rated hotel higher. Location is good, breakfast was surprisingly good and pool area is very good.
reviews.title: Agree with most of Jabdog's 6/6/08 Review below

reviews.text: At €85 it was good value for money. A higher rate would change the equation.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: We were in Estoril because my husband was attending a scientific conference here. The conference people booked the hotel.
reviews.title: things are seldom what they seem

likes.liked: — Beautiful antique building with separate living room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2007 for 5 nights. Hotel was really lovely - the building itself has a lot more character than many of the 60's/70's style breeze block buildings at the bottom of the hill, although the views are limited. The room was really contemporary with all mod cons needed and the hotel facilities (pool etc.) were great. It's in a good location - just 5 minutes walk down to the seaside, and then it's easy to get into Lisbon by train, to walk/train to Caiscais or to go further afield (Sintra). We had no complaints at all and for the price we paid felt it was excellent value for money (we booked online through Thomson).
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay.....

likes.disliked: — View is out over casino gardens (not the sea)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The weather was not good which meant the room was cold. We had a suite on the top floor. There were draughts blowing through badly fitted windows. The only remedy for this was extra blankets, no change of room was offered, even though the hotel had very few guests at the time. The heating was not working very well.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers

reviews.text: The suite had a tiny bathroom with towels badly worn and some having holes in them, the bidet was not fixed properly to the floor and was in fact dangerous. The shower leaked onto the floor.
reviews.title: Staff should provide a better service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But worst of all was the restaurant, we only risked breakfast !!! The majority of the crockery was chipped. Luke warm, unclean water for tea making, a very poor selection of foods.The staff never spoke or greeted us as we arrived. The only words said were "room number". When we brought a problem re the scrambled eggs, they were beyond eating as we assume they were there for severel hours, the waitress merely smiled!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely big old hotel with super rooms and a lovely pool area. You walk down the steep hill to the beach, which is full of locals and has a great atmosphere. Fab train service that takes you along the coast and to the capital Lisbon. Caiscais is also a good beach, mainly locals when we were there (I know this because when it rained we stayed on our loungers which had 'roofs' on them, while all the locals fled to the safety and dryness of the cafe!
reviews.title: GRAND PLACE!

likes.disliked: — Steep climb back up to the hotel after a day on the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of bars and restaurants - would recommend this hotel and this area of Portugal.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am surprised that some folks rated this hotel as "terrible." At the very worst, its "average." However, my wife and I loved this place. The room was big and spacious. The view was great (Rm 403) and we had great interactions with the staff. They were helpful and, at times, even went out of their way to meet our request.
reviews.title: Comfortable, but a bit lacking in atmosphere

likes.liked: — Nice quality furnishings and comfortable bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is true, that the food and drinks are some what expensive, but that is to be assumed for most hotel. We both thought that the breakfast was great. Eggs, bacon, cereal, toast and breads, fruit, tea/coffee, sausage, juice, and more. It was all you need in a breakfast. It was not a gourmet meal by any means but it was still well catered. If you want to grab some great food and save some cash, there is a great little market about 100 yds away from the hotel (going toward the beach).
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed

likes.disliked: — No tea or coffe making facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds of the hotel are quite nice as well. There are some great out door seating areas and a pool. The little town of Estoril is pretty quiet with the biggest attraction being the casino. However, you can walk about half a mile or take a 1 minute train ride (1.15 euro) to Cascais which is a great little town. Cascais has many great restaurants, beaches, shops, and charm. We found that the Indian food restaurant near the train station was superb!
reviews.title: A really great discreet little hotel

description: The charming and charismatic Hotel Inglaterra is located in the centre of famous Estoril walking distance to the rail station, casino and beach. The building of great architectonic beauty is a palace dating back to the start the 20th century with a personalized decoration in perfect balance of classic and contemporaneous comfort.
